def.dt: :of a kind that has been respected for a long time the classical [=traditional] idea of beauty classical ballet

:of or relating to the ancient Greek and Roman world and especially to its language, literature, art, etc. the classical [=ancient] and medieval worlds classical literature/art the classical tradition a classical scholar
:relating to music in a European tradition that includes opera and symphony and that is generally considered more serious than other kinds of music classical music/composers
:teaching ideas about literature, art, science, etc., rather than practical skills a classical curriculum/education
:very typical :classic a classical example of propaganda the classical symptoms of the disease

utxt.vi: a classically trained actress [=an actress who was trained in traditional methods of acting]
Symptoms classically include fatigue and muscle soreness.
